qas.question: What lucrative trade contributed greatly to Charles Town's growth?
When did Charles Town become the fourth largest colonial port?
Who made up the majority of Charles Town population in 1708?
People of African descent were the majority in Charleston until what mass movement?
When did the Great Migration occur?
What unlucrative trade contributed greatly to Charles Town's growth?
When did Charles Town become the fifth largest colonial port?
Who made up the majority of Charles Town population in 1780?
People of African descent were the minority in Charleston until what mass movement?
When didn't the Great Migration occur?

context: By the mid-18th century, Charles Town had become a bustling trade center, the hub of the Atlantic trade for the southern colonies. Charles Towne was also the wealthiest and largest city south of Philadelphia, in part because of the lucrative <a0_0><b5_0>slave trade<b5_0/><a0_0/>. By <a1_0><b6_0>1770<b6_0/><a1_0/>, it was the fourth-largest port in the colonies, after Boston, New York, and Philadelphia, with a population of 11,000—slightly more than half of them <b7_0>slaves<b7_0/>. By 1708, the majority of the colony's population was <a2_0>slaves<a2_0/>, and the future state would continue to be a majority of African descent until after <a3_0><b8_0>the Great Migration<b8_0/><a3_0/> of <a4_0><b9_0>the early 20th century<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
